text: Alice Marie Coachman (November 9, 1923 â€“ July 14, 2014) was an American athlete. She specialized in high jump. She was the first black woman to win an Olympic gold medal. In 2002 she was designated a Women's History Month Honoree by the National Women's History Project. ==References== ==Other websites== *Alice Coachman's oral history video excerpts at The National Visionary Leadership Project * Alice Coachman (Entry in the New Georgia Encyclopedia) Category:1923 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Olympic gold medalists for the United States Category:Deaths from cardiac arrest Category:Sportspeople from Georgia (U.S. state)
title: Alice Coachman
